title: summaryByVisit
text: demonstrate various functionalities function, create small dataset. three hypotetical lab-values: LDH, ANC Lymphocytes. lab-value measured 10 time points (visits), can divided three visit groups (baseline, treatment follow-). addition, grouping variable called ‘arm’.
code: data<-NULL visit <- c(paste0(rep("Visit ", 10), rbind(c(1:10))),            paste0(rep("Visit ", 10), rbind(c(1:10))),            paste0(rep("Visit ", 10), rbind(c(1:10)))) data <- as.data.frame(cbind( visit, rnorm(30))) data<-as.data.frame(rbind(data, data, data, data, data)) data$visitgroup<- ifelse(data$visit %in% c("Visit 1", "Visit 2"), "Baseline", ifelse(data$visit %in% c("Visit 3", "Visit 4"), "Treatment", "Follow-up")) data$visitgroup<-factor(data$visitgroup, levels = c("Baseline", "Treatment", "Follow-up")) data$LDH<-rnorm(150) data$Lymphocytes<-rnorm(150) data$ANC<-rnorm(150) data$LDH[3]<-NA data$arm<- c(rep("Arm A", 70), rep("Arm B", 80))

title: summaryByVisit
code: summaryByVisit(data,          vars = c("LDH", "Lymphocytes", "ANC"),          visit = "visit")

title: summaryByVisit
code: summaryByVisit(data,          vars = c("LDH", "Lymphocytes", "ANC"),          visitgroup = "visitgroup",          visit = "visit")

title: summaryByVisit
code: summaryByVisit(data,          vars = c("LDH", "Lymphocytes", "ANC"),          group = "arm",          visitgroup = "visitgroup",          visit = "visit") summaryByVisit(data,          vars = c("LDH", "Lymphocytes", "ANC"),          group = "arm",          overall = TRUE,          visitgroup = "visitgroup",          visit = "visit")

title: summaryByVisit
code: summaryByVisit(data,          vars = c("LDH", "Lymphocytes", "ANC"),          group = "arm",          overall = TRUE,          visitgroup = "visitgroup",          visit = "visit",          add_n = TRUE)

title: summaryByVisit
text: improve costumization

title: summaryLevels
text: demonstrate various functionalities function, create small dataset. factor interest ‘Site progression’. site progression, presence absence decoded separate column. addition, grouping variable called ‘arm’.
code: data<- as.data.frame(cbind(c(1:10), c("A","A","A","A","A","B","B","B","B","B"),                             c("absent","present","absent","present","absent","absent","present","absent","present","absent"),                             c("absent","absent","present","absent","absent","absent","absent","absent","absent","absent"),                             c("present","absent","present","present","present","present","present","present","present","present"))) names(data)<-c("upn", "arm", "liver", "lung", "brain")

title: summaryLevels
text: Now, use summarySCI::summaryLevels collapse columns ‘liver’, ‘lung’ ‘brain’ single factor named ‘Site progression’. presence site progression decoded ‘present’. need define columns containing factor levels using vars argument. Site progression1 N = 102 liver 4 (40%) lung 1 (10%) brain 9 (90%) 1More one entry possible 2n (%) footnote emphazises patient may one site progression. Therefore, column percentages neccessarily add 100%.
code: summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       label = "Site of progression",                       levels= "present",)

title: summaryLevels
text: can stratify table groups via group argument. overall column can still shown desired, using overall = TRUE argument. Site progression1  N = 52 B  N = 52 liver 2 (40%) 2 (40%) lung 1 (20%) 0 (0%) brain 4 (80%) 5 (100%) 1More one entry possible 2n (%) Site progression1 Overall  N = 102  N = 52 B  N = 52 liver 4 (40%) 2 (40%) 2 (40%) lung 1 (10%) 1 (20%) 0 (0%) brain 9 (90%) 4 (80%) 5 (100%) 1More one entry possible 2n (%)
code: summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       group = "arm",                       label = "Site of progression",                       levels= "present") summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       group = "arm",                       label = "Site of progression",                       levels= "present",                       overall = TRUE)

title: summaryLevels
text: statistical test can performed level separately argument test set TRUE. type test can changed test_cat argument. Options include chisq.test, chisq.test..correct, fisher.test (default) Site progression1  N = 52 B  N = 52 p-value3 liver 2 (40%) 2 (40%) >0.99 lung 1 (20%) 0 (0%) >0.99 brain 4 (80%) 5 (100%) >0.99 1More one entry possible 2n (%) 3Fisher's exact test Site progression1  N = 52 B  N = 52 p-value3 liver 2 (40%) 2 (40%) >0.99 lung 1 (20%) 0 (0%) >0.99 brain 4 (80%) 5 (100%) >0.99 1More one entry possible 2n (%) 3Pearson's Chi-squared test
code: summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       group = "arm",                       label = "Site of progression",                       test = TRUE,,                       levels= "present") summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       group = "arm",                       levels= "present",                       label = "Site of progression",                       test = TRUE,                       test_cat = "chisq.test") #> The following warnings were returned during `add_p()`: #> ! For variable `liver` (`arm`) and "statistic", "p.value", and "parameter" #>   statistics: Chi-squared approximation may be incorrect #> The following warnings were returned during `add_p()`: #> ! For variable `lung` (`arm`) and "statistic", "p.value", and "parameter" #>   statistics: Chi-squared approximation may be incorrect #> The following warnings were returned during `add_p()`: #> ! For variable `brain` (`arm`) and "statistic", "p.value", and "parameter" #>   statistics: Chi-squared approximation may be incorrect

title: summaryLevels
text: confidence interval can added, requested using statement ci = TRUE. confidence level can adjusted conf_level. type confidence interval can chosen using command ci_cat. Site progression1  N = 52 90% CI B  N = 52 90% CI p-value3 liver 2 (40%) [9.0%, 80%] 2 (40%) [9.0%, 80%] >0.99 lung 1 (20%) [1.4%, 65%] 0 (0%) [0.00%, 47%] >0.99 brain 4 (80%) [35%, 99%] 5 (100%) [53%, 100%] >0.99 1More one entry possible 2n (%) 3Fisher's exact test Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval
code: summarySCI::summaryLevels(data=data,                       vars = c("liver", "lung", "brain"),                       group = "arm",                       label = "Site of progression",                       levels= "present",                       test = TRUE,                       test_cat = "fisher.test",                       ci=TRUE,                       conf_level = 0.9,                       overall = FALSE)

title: summaryLevels
text: make possible stack tables

title: Summary table
text: demonstrate various functionalities function use dataset survival::colon. dataset colon contains data 1858 patients one first successful trials adjuvant chemotherapy colon cancer. simplicity, focus recurrence , two treatment groups, four variable: treatment group (rx), sex (Male), age (age) extent local spread (extent). also add missing values variable extent.
code: library(survival) data(cancer, package="survival")  colon1 <-  colon %>%   group_by(id) %>%   slice(1) %>% # Select the first row within each id group   ungroup() set.seed(123) colon2 <- colon1 %>%   select(rx, sex, age, extent) %>%   filter(rx != "Lev") %>%   mutate(rx = if_else(rx == "Obs", "Control", rx),          extent = if_else(row_number() %in% sample(row_number(), size = round(0.1 * n())), NA, extent)) %>%    rename(Male = sex) %>%    mutate(extent = as.factor(extent)) head(colon2) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   rx       Male   age extent #>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> <fct>  #> 1 Lev+5FU     1    43 3      #> 2 Lev+5FU     1    63 3      #> 3 Control     0    71 2      #> 4 Lev+5FU     0    66 3      #> 5 Control     1    69 3      #> 6 Lev+5FU     0    57 3

title: Summary table
text: default, function produces table variables present dataset. Characteristic N = 6191 rx  Control 315 (51%) Lev+5FU 304 (49%) Male  0 312 (50%) 1 307 (50%) age 61.0 (18.0, 85.0) extent  1 17 (3%) 2 68 (11%) 3 446 (72%) 4 26 (4%) Missing 62 (10%) 1n (%); Median (Min, Max)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2)

title: Summary table
text: displayed name variable label exists dataset variable name label present dataset (case example). order customize displayed name, argument labels can used: Characteristic N = 6191 Arm  Control 315 (51%) Lev+5FU 304 (49%) Male  0 312 (50%) 1 307 (50%) Age 61.0 (18.0, 85.0) Extent  1 17 (3%) 2 68 (11%) 3 446 (72%) 4 26 (4%) Missing 62 (10%) 1n (%); Median (Min, Max) Equivalently, labels can added directly datase.
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,                   labels = list(rx = "Arm", age = "Age", extent = "Extent"))

title: Summary table
text: number obervations can added column seting argument add_n TRUE. Characteristic N N = 6191 Arm 619  Control  315 (51%) Lev+5FU  304 (49%) Male 619  0  312 (50%) 1  307 (50%) Age 619 61.0 (18.0, 85.0) Extent 619  1  17 (3%) 2  68 (11%) 3  446 (72%) 4  26 (4%) Missing  62 (10%) 1n (%); Median (Min, Max)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,                   labels = list(rx = "Arm", age = "Age", extent = "Extent"),               add_n = TRUE)

title: Summary table
code: summaryTable(data = colon2, group = "rx",               labels = list(age = "Age", extent = "Extent")) summaryTable(data = colon2, group = "rx", overall = TRUE,                labels = list(age = "Age", extent = "Extent"))

title: Summary table
text: defaults summaryTable different default gtsummary::tbl_summary. following rules apply: factor variables: !!! categorical variables wih two levels? considered dichotomous? Check ! write rest. specific variables included table, can written argument vars. Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Age 60.0 (18.0, 85.0) 62.0 (26.0, 81.0) 1Median (Min, Max) default, function plots median range continuous variables. number options available, using argument stat_cont.
code: summaryTable(data = colon2, group = "rx", vars = "age",               labels = list(age = "Age"))

title: Summary table
text: Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Age 60.0 (53.0, 68.0) 62.0 (52.0, 70.0) 1Median (Q1, Q3)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2, group = "rx", vars = "age",               stat_cont = "median_IQR",                labels = list(age = "Age"))

title: Summary table
text: Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Age 59.5 (12.0) 59.7 (12.3) 1Mean (SD)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "age",               stat_cont = "mean_sd",                labels = list(age = "Age"))

title: Summary table
text: default, p-value confidence (CI) displayed. p-values can added setting test TRUE CI setting ci TRUE. default test CI types continuous variable wilcox.test. can changed test_cont ci_cont, respectively. Characteristic Control  N = 3151 95% CI Lev+5FU  N = 3041 95% CI p-value2 Age 59.5 (12.0) [59, 62] 59.7 (12.3) [59, 62] 0.60 1Mean (SD) 2Wilcoxon rank sum test Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "age",               stat_cont = "mean_sd",               test = TRUE,              ci = TRUE,              labels = list(age = "Age")              )

title: Summary table
text: categorical variables, percentage automatically added next missing. can disabled setting argument missing FALSE. Characteristic Control  N = 3151 95% CI Lev+5FU  N = 3041 95% CI p-value2 Extent     0.37 1 8 (3%) [1.2%, 5.1%] 9 (3%) [1.5%, 5.7%]  2 38 (12%) [8.8%, 16%] 30 (10%) [6.9%, 14%]  3 222 (70%) [65%, 75%] 224 (74%) [68%, 78%]  4 17 (5%) [3.3%, 8.7%] 9 (3%) [1.5%, 5.7%]  Missing 30 (10%) [6.6%, 13%] 32 (11%) [7.4%, 15%]  1n (%) 2Fisher's exact test Abbreviation: CI = Confidence Interval Note p-value always calculated ignoring missing values. categorical variables, default test type chisq.test default CI types wilson. can changed test_cat ci_cat, respectively. tables without missing values can also put next setting missing "".  missing Without missing Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Extent     1 8 (3%) 9 (3%) 8 (3%) 9 (3%) 2 38 (12%) 30 (10%) 38 (13%) 30 (11%) 3 222 (70%) 224 (74%) 222 (78%) 224 (82%) 4 17 (5%) 9 (3%) 17 (6%) 9 (3%) Missing 30 (10%) 32 (11%)   1n (%)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "extent",               test = TRUE,              ci = TRUE,              missing_percent = TRUE,               labels = list(extent = "Extent")              ) summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "extent",               missing_percent = "both",                labels = list(extent = "Extent")              )

title: Summary table
text: default, levels showed binary variables. Setting argument binary TRUE shows one level: Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Male 166 (53%) 141 (46%) 1n (%) Characteristic Control  N = 3151 Lev+5FU  N = 3041 Male 166 (53%) 141 (46%) 1n (%)
code: summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "Male",               missing_percent = FALSE              ) summaryTable(data = colon2,               group = "rx",               vars = "Male",               missing_percent = FALSE)

title: Summary table
text: Digits can customized arguments digits_contand digits_cat.

code: @Manual{,   title = {summarySCI: Produces publication-ready summary tables},   author = {Sämi Schär and Charlotte Micheloud},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://swisscancerinstitute-statistics.github.io/summaryswisscancerinstitute/}, }

title: Produces publication-ready summary tables
text: Welcome development branch package function summaryTable package summarySCI. can install development version using
code: devtools::install_github(   repo = "SAKK-Statistics/summarySCI",   ref = "dev-branch",   dependencies = TRUE )

what: Creates publication-ready summary tables for continuous data grouped, by visit — summaryByVisit
title: Creates publication-ready summary tables for continuous data grouped, by visit — summaryByVisit
text: Creates publication-ready summary tables continuous data grouped, visit

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables for continuous data grouped, by visit — summaryByVisit
code: summaryByVisit(   data,   vars = NULL,   group = NULL,   stat_cont = "median_range",   visit = "visit",   visitgroup = NULL,   add_n = FALSE,   overall = FALSE,   as_flex_table = TRUE )

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables for continuous data grouped, by visit — summaryByVisit
text: data data frame tibble containing data summarized. vars Continuous variables include summary table. Default variables present data except group. group single column data. Summary statistics stratified according variable. Default NULL. maximum 3 groups currently supported. stat_cont Summary statistic display continuous variables. Options include "median_IQR", "median_range" (default), "mean_sd", "mean_se" "geomMean_sd". visit Name stratum summary statistics displayed line. Typically, "visit". visitgroup grouping variable stratum summary statistics displayed line. Must ordered factor. Typically, visit group e.g., baseline, follow-etc. add_n Logical. column sample size (N) shown. Default FALSE. overall Logical. TRUE, additional column total added table. Ignored, groups defined. Default FALSE. as_flex_table Logical. TRUE, output converted flex_table object. Default TRUE.

title: summaryLevels — summaryLevels
text: Collapses factor levels multiple columns one creates summary table.

title: summaryLevels — summaryLevels
code: summaryLevels(   data,   vars = NULL,   group = NULL,   label = NULL,   levels = NULL,   stat_cat = "n_percent",   test = FALSE,   test_cat = "fisher.test",   ci = FALSE,   ci_cat = "wilson",   conf_level = 0.95,   overall = FALSE,   as_flex_table = TRUE )

title: summaryLevels — summaryLevels
text: data data frame tibble containing data summarized. vars Variables include summary table. Default variables present data except group. group single column data. Summary statistics stratified according variable. Default NULL. label list containing labels used variables table. NULL, labels automaticall taken dataset. label present, variable name taken. levels = vector containing values indicating presence factor level. Included defaul "1", "yes", "Yes". stat_cat Summary statistic display categorical variables. Options include "n_percent" (default) "n", "n_N". test Logical. Indicates whether p-values displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE test_cat Test type used calculated p-value categorical variables.  used test = TRUE. Options include "chisq.test", "chisq.test..correct", "fisher.test" (default). ci Logical. Indicates whether CI displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE. ci_cat Confidence interval method categorical variables. Options include "wilson" (default), "wilson..correct", "clopper.pearson", "wald", "wald..correct", "agresti.coull" "jeffreys". NULL, CI displayed. conf_level Confidence level. Default 0.95. overall Logical. TRUE, additional column total added table. Default FALSE. as_flex_table Logical. TRUE (default) gtsummary object converted flextable object. Useful rendering Word.

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
text: Creates publication-ready summary tables based gtsummary package.

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
code: summaryTable(   data,   vars = NULL,   group = NULL,   labels = NULL,   stat_cont = "median_range",   stat_cat = "n_percent",   continuous_as = "continuous",   dichotomous_as = "dichotomous",   type = NULL,   value = NULL,   test = FALSE,   test_cont = "wilcox.test",   test_cat = "fisher.test",   ci = FALSE,   ci_cont = "wilcox.test",   ci_cat = "wilson",   conf_level = 0.95,   digits_cont = 1,   digits_cat = 0,   missing = TRUE,   missing_percent = TRUE,   missing_text = "Missing",   overall = FALSE,   add_n = FALSE,   as_flex_table = TRUE )

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
text: data data frame tibble containing data summarized. vars Variables include summary table. Default variables present data except group. group single column data. Summary statistics stratified according variable. Default NULL. labels list containing labels used variables table. NULL, labels automatically taken dataset. label present, variable name taken. stat_cont Summary statistic display continuous variables. Options include "median_IQR", "median_range" (default), "mean_sd", "mean_se" "geomMean_sd". stat_cat Summary statistic display categorical variables. Options include "n_percent" (default) "n", "n_N". continuous_as Type continuous variables dichotomous_as Type dichotomous variables type Specifies summary type. Accepted values c("continuous", "continuous2", "categorical", "dichotomous"). specified, default type assigned. See details. value Specifies level variable display single row. test Logical. Indicates whether p-values displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE test_cont Test type used calculate p-value continuous variables. used test = TRUE. Options include "t.test", "oneway.test", "kruskal.test", "wilcox.test" (default), "paired.t.test", "paired.wilcox.test" test_cat Test type used calculated p-value categorical variables.  used test = TRUE. Options include "fisher.test" (default), "chisq.test", "chisq.test..correct". ci Logical. Indicates whether CI displayed (TRUE) (FALSE). Default FALSE. ci_cont Confidence interval method continuous variables. used ci = TRUE. Options include "t.test" "wilcox.test" (default). ci_cat Confidence interval method categorical variables. Options include "wilson" (default), "wilson..correct", "clopper.pearson", "wald", "wald..correct", "agresti.coull" "jeffreys". NULL, CI displayed. conf_level Confidence level. Default 0.95. digits_cont Digits summary statistics CI continuous variables. Default 1. digits_cat Digits summary statistics CI categorical variables. Default 0. missing Logical. TRUE (default), missing values shown. missing_percent Indicates whether percentages missings shown (TRUE, default) (FALSE) categorical variables. "", options displayed next . missing_text String indicating text shown missing row. Default "Missing". overall Logical. TRUE, additional column total added table. Default FALSE. add_n Logical. TRUE, additional column total number non-missing observations variable. as_flex_table Logical. TRUE (default) gtsummary object converted flextable object. Useful rendering Word.

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
text: Type values arguments default, numeric variables 2 unique values considered continuous. can changed using type argument type = list(vars ~ "categorical")

title: Creates publication-ready summary tables — summaryTable
text: Characteristic N = 2281 Institution code 11.0 (1.0, 33.0) Missing 1 Time 255.5 (5.0, 1,022.0) Age 63.0 (39.0, 82.0) ECOG score 1.0 (0.0, 3.0) Missing 1 1Median (Min, Max)
